data.name: [NCP] No Comments Please : erase all comments in a C/C++ code .
data.description:
Do you use **comments** when you are coding? I hope yes! 
In this kata you have to do something weird: delete all C/C++ like comments. Yes, you have understood perfectly. 

Example (I-O):

```c++
int main() {
  int a = 10; // a value is ten
}
```

```c++
int main() {
  int a = 10; 
}
```

Here we can't work with cpp/h files (or probably idk how), so I have prepared some strings that contain a well formatted and working C++ code. You have to write a function that return another string, containing the same working C++ code but without comments.

Third string is:
```c++
"int main() {\n\tint hi; // 1) comment\n\tint hello; /* 2) comment */\n\n\n\tint ciao; /* 6) comment\n*\n*\n*\n*\n*/\n// 9) comment /*\n\n\n\tint isNotAComment;\n/* 10) comment\n//\n*/\tint i = 9; // 11) comment\n}\n"
```
that corresponds to this C++ code:
```c++
int main() {
	int hi; // 1) comment
	int hello; /* 2) comment */


	int ciao; /* 6) comment
*
*
*
*
*/
// 9) comment /*


	int isNotAComment;
/* 10) comment
//
*/	int i = 9; // 11) comment
}

```
 and right result is:
 
  ```c++
 "int main() {\n\tint hi; \n\tint hello; \n\n\n\tint ciao; \n\n\n\tint isNotAComment;\n\tint i = 9; \n}\n"
 ```
 that corresponds to this C++ code:
 
 ```c++
int main() {
	int hi; 
	int hello; 


	int ciao; 


	int isNotAComment;
	int i = 9; 
}

```

Follow this guidelines:

- if a line is void, it will be replaced by a '\n' (void means with **ONLY** [space] or  [\t] or [\n] or a mix of them)

input:
```c++
int a = 10;
[\n]
[\t][\n]
[space][\n]
[\t][space][space][\n]
int b = 12;
```
output:
```c++
int a = 10;
[\n]
[\n]
[\n]
[\n]
int b = 12;
```

- if there is a comment, all the comment's characters have to be erased ("//" "/\*" "\*/" included) and if a line is formed only by a comment, it will be erased. Other characters should not be deleted.

input:
```c++
int a = 10;//comment
/* comment
comment2
*/
/*hi*/[\t]int b = 12;[space]// hi to everyone
```
output:
```c++
int a = 10;
[\t]int b = 12;[space]
```

- if there is a void line inside a multiline comment, it should not be deleted but replaced with a [\n]

input:
```c++
int a = 10;
/*
*
[\t][space][\n]
[\n]
*
*/
int b = 12;
```
output:
```c++
int a = 10;
[\n]
[\n]
int b = 12;
```

- don't forget '\' comments

input:
```c++
int a = 10;
// comment\
comment2\
comment3
[\n]
int b = 12;
```
output:
```c++
int a = 10;
[\n]
int b = 12;
```

- at the end of each output line must be [\n], also last one

input:
```c++
int main() {[\n]
// comment
}
```

input:
```c++
int main() {[\n]
// comment
}[\n]
```

output:
```c++
int main() {[\n]
}[\n]
```

Input code is a compilable C++ code, so output code must be the same code: compilable but without comments!

Can you do this?
